job_title: PATIENT REGISTRATION TECHNICIAN in Norfolk, VA
pros:
I’ve been here 5 years. I accepted the position after being told of all the advancement opportunities CHKD has to offer. 
After the first year things declined. Positions within the department became available, those that applied within the department were looked over, and told they needed more experience. I watched this occur time and time again. Every single time, qualified employees within the department were looked over, and the position given to other employees within another department in the same division. Employees with the same qualification as those that applied within the department. Every single person that would be hired to fill positions in the department, all came from the same department that shared space on the same floor with upper management. I’ve watched employees try to transfer out of the department, and have it blocked by management. It has gotten to the point staff leaves CHKD altogether. They force good employees out of the organization, and keep those that receive complaints. This is not an organization that cares about their staff. They care more about bodies filling positions, and bringing money in with patients. I know people who tried for years to get into CHKD, some even called it their dream, just to walk away in the end because of how management treats their employees. Filing complaints with HR get you no where, it will only be brushed under the rug, and cost you your job. Do yourself a favor, work at Sentara, or a private practice. You’ll be provided with better pay, and advancement opportunities. 

If you still want to work at CHKD and take the chance…be prepared for the workplace politics, gossip, drama, and the average pay of $15 hr for registration.
cons:
Management , Advancement opportunities,
Pay, lack of honesty from higher ups, supporr

job_title: Patient Access Tech in Chesapeake, VA
pros: I love the atmosphere of working at CHKD!
cons: Depending on what department you work in, the parents can be extremely rude and hard to work with.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Virginia Beach, VA

pros: They will give you a raise every year. Vacation requests are almost guaranteed you will get it.
cons: Full of racism, discrimination and rudeness. The supervisor will yell at you and humiliate you in front of everyone if you make a mistake. I had someone constantly picking on me, threatening me, called me a fkn btch outside of work, i filed complain, but management did nothing, and deleted my file. Someone constantly calling me names, telling people my food stinks and I am eating trash; when the pandemic starts he calls me a coronar virus, claiming that I eat bats. Complained to the manager, he didn't want to do anything, no follow-up at all. Finally complained to the HR, he had to follow-up with me, the first thing he said to me was, "are you happy now"? The most pathetic part is, after couple years, they will reach out to me, ask for the complaint that I had filed and they throw it away, because they want to get rid of the person themselves. I was too naive and scared to put up with all this without a lawsuit. Don't waste your time there unless you're white.

pros: there is some job fulfillment with knowing that you're helping sick kids get better

pros: Lots of opportunity for any type of job. You can be proud of working at CHKD--it's amazing how many people thank me for my work when they find out I work at CHKD and I'm not even a nurse! CHKD also reimburses up to $5,250 a year in tuition reimbursement if you are getting a degree. Lots of promotional opportunities and ability to apply to other roles once hired. Health benefits are really great and the premiums are low compared to other employers. Lots of people have worked here for 10, 20, even 40 years, so you know it's a great place to work when you see that!
cons: It's a non-profit so maybe not as lucrative as other companies, but you don't feel like a number here.

review_title: I smiled more when I left than when I was hired.
pros:
* Co-Workers - they make life bearable (almost)
* The Mission - you really do make a difference with children and families struggling through illness
cons:
* Management - the in-fighting (or squabbling) is incessant and depressing
* Supervisors - As a person who has been in the work force for 20+ yrs, my CHKD manager leads the pack as worst supervisor/boss.  Because of a long career, talking to HR or upper management proved futile and even more disheartening.  Cronyism at its finest.
* Overload - Too much work, too few employees
* Boundaries - Overt (and remorseless) racism and an overwhelming and vocal disregard to others' religious (or non-religious) beliefs outside of the majority

review_title: Corp. identity heavy on Foundation history, light on innovative healthcare delivery
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Virginia Beach, VA
pros: Office culture here is very relaxed, flexible and welcoming.  Health system is growing in fits and starts, So will likely need more skilled personnel in the next 2-5 years.  Middle-management generally very open to change.
cons: Little HR turnover encourages staleness.  Leadership biography reflects generally narrow backgrounds, many locals.  Information technology probably 5 years behind industry leaders / 3 years behind Industry standards.  Conservation and environmental impact would not seem to be on the radar.

review_title: The only reasons to work here are the patients
pros: Only pediatric hospital in the immediate area, great staff physicians, amazing patients, strong community support
cons: Poor pay, poor benefits, employees are very condescending towards each other creating a negative work environment, managers play favorites, difficult to get time off, hospital offers tuition assistance however makes it difficult to claim, raises are few and far between, raises are small when given, hospital does not recognize employees for excellent work, "guilty until proven innocent" frame of mind

review_title: CHKD is a good company to work for.
pros: I've had a raise every year and besides from the fact that the cost of the medical insurance for a part time employee is over $100 a payday, the benefits are pretty good.
cons: CHKD is very strict on time and attendance. As a part time employee you can not have more than one occurrence or more than one tardy in a 3 month rolling period with a disciplinary action.

review_title: CHKD...not all its cracked up to be!!
job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Norfolk, VA
pros: The care given to the patients is excellent.
cons: The employees are not treated very well, the pay is poor compared to the extremly high standard of living in this area. They do not give annual raises for a job well-done. Only standard of living raises which is usually less than 10 - 25 cents a year. Whena n emloyee calls in sick they are either given a hard time about it, or made to feel guilty upon their return. Also when there has been emergencies and staff has not been able to come in or leave because of it, the supervisors act like its just another excuse and don't care. They haven't even bothered to ask if everything was OK. The 2 supervisors in my department, were in my exact position less than 1 year ago. They have no managerial experience or training and treat the employees very poorly!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Virginia Beach, VA
pros:
Relatively easy application/interview process. Everything was prompt and their communication was very professional. My interview and job offer were a little delayed due to everything happening around the holidays, but my contact person was good about keeping me up to date throughout the process.
This was a good job for me during the time in between undergrad and grad school
cons: Specific to this position (entry level with no real experience required): Low pay with no potential for a raise

review_title: It could be so much more...

Advancement opportunities are not really earned but given to friends as perks. There is no retention program, there is no retention.
